intro: Diodia hyssopifolia var. articulata, commonly known as the jointed diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies.
